alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 5:01PM EDT until June 27 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Morris County in northern New Jersey... Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Northeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 501 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Belvidere, or 10 miles northeast of Easton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hackettstown, Washington, Blairstown, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Hope, East Bangor, Great Meadows-Vienna, Brass Castle, Delaware Water Gap, Roxburg, Columbia, Beatyestown, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Roseto, Portland and Beattyestown. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 18. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
